metadata.title: CVE-2024-42296 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:f2fs: fix return value of f2fs_convert_inline_inode()If device is readonly, make f2fs_convert_inline_inode()return EROFS instead of zero, otherwise it may triggerpanic during writeback of inline inode's dirty page asbelow: f2fs_write_single_data_page+0xbb6/0x1e90 fs/f2fs/data.c:2888 f2fs_write_cache_pages fs/f2fs/data.c:3187 [inline] __f2fs_write_data_pages fs/f2fs/data.c:3342 [inline] f2fs_write_data_pages+0x1efe/0x3a90 fs/f2fs/data.c:3369 do_writepages+0x359/0x870 mm/page-writeback.c:2634 filemap_fdatawrite_wbc+0x125/0x180 mm/filemap.c:397 __filemap_fdatawrite_range mm/filemap.c:430 [inline] file_write_and_wait_range+0x1aa/0x290 mm/filemap.c:788 f2fs_do_sync_file+0x68a/0x1ae0 fs/f2fs/file.c:276 generic_write_sync include/linux/fs.h:2806 [inline] f2fs_file_write_iter+0x7bd/0x24e0 fs/f2fs/file.c:4977 call_write_iter include/linux/fs.h:2114 [inline] new_sync_write fs/read_write.c:497 [inline] vfs_write+0xa72/0xc90 fs/read_write.c:590 ksys_write+0x1a0/0x2c0 fs/read_write.c:643 do_syscall_x64 arch/x86/entry/common.c:52 [inline] do_syscall_64+0xf5/0x240 arch/x86/entry/common.c:83 entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x77/0x7f

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42296` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-50-generic - 6.8.0-50.51
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-50-generic - 6.8.0-50.51
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-50-generic-64k - 6.8.0-50.51
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1020-aws - 6.8.0-1020.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1019-gcp - 6.8.0-1019.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1015-gke - 6.8.0-1015.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1017-ibm - 6.8.0-1017.17
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-50-lowlatency - 6.8.0-50.51.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-50-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-50.51.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1017-oracle - 6.8.0-1017.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1017-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1017.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1018-oem - 6.8.0-1018.18
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1016-raspi - 6.8.0-1016.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1016.23
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-50.51').
linux-aws package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1020.22').
linux-azure package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.0-1019.22').
linux-gcp package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1019.21').
linux-gke package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1015.19').
linux-ibm package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1017.17').
linux-lowlatency package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-50.51.1').
linux-oracle package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1017.18').
linux-oem-6.8 package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1018.18').
linux-raspi package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1016.18').
linux-intel package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1016.23').
linux-raspi-realtime package in realtime/noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.0-2015.16').
linux-realtime package in realtime/noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.1-1013.14').
